messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: The Last Samurai
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Lou, sorry, poor choice of words on my behalf, I see an older copy as being a reproduction of the original, thus it is a repo in a sense. this of course
messages.messageBody:
Hi Lou, sorry, poor choice of words on my behalf, I see an older copy as being a reproduction of the original, thus it is a repo in a sense. this of course gets confused with repo's as in modern/present day items. No, I think it looks like it may be from around the late edo era/early meiji era, but not the original.

Rich
----- Original Message -----
From: JapaneseSwords@...
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, November 26, 2003 1:20 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: The Last Samurai


Rich if that is a repro it looks good enough to fool me. You sure the
translator is reading it right. Maybe the seller is saying it is an older copy or
not a repro.

Lou

messages.subject: Re: The Last Samurai
messages.msgSnippet: And remember to tell all the newbies that Bungo Takada means Bravery Foremost !!!  Also, best deals on gunto from The Chicken ( gunto means worhty
messages.messageBody:
And remember to tell all the newbies that "Bungo Takada"
means "Bravery Foremost"!!! Also, best deals on gunto from The
Chicken ("gunto" means "worhty blade")..

NC ;o)

messages.subject: The Last Samurai
messages.msgSnippet: Fellow List Members, I m not sure how many of you have gotten the chance to see The Last Samurai yet as I m not sure when it comes out stateside and
messages.messageBody:
Fellow List Members,

I'm not sure how many of you have gotten the chance to
see "The Last Samurai" yet as I'm not sure when it
comes out stateside and elsewhere. I went last night
to see it with my wife. I've got to say that I was
extremely well done in my humble opinion. I can see
this movie propelling a lot of new students into Kendo
dojo�s as well as the other areas of martial arts. The
same will probably happen to the sword collecting
community as well. So if changes are to be made to
attract new members to the sword groups I would
suggest that NOW would be the time to update your
sites with new information for the newer crowd. Forget
the market surveys and polling (no offence Pat) but
you won�t need them. Within the next month and a half
to two months I would imagine that anyone with a
website that is Japanese Sword or Samurai related is
going to be getting a lot of traffic and email with
questions. Rich S your site is going to be running way
over it�s bandwidth I�m sure. It will probably happen
again when this movie makes the jump to DVD/VHS and
the rest who haddn�t seen it in theaters see it at
home. I don�t want to give away any of the story as
it�s a movie that you have to see for yourself. But I
would suggest seeing it if nothing else than for the
final battle scene. Enjoy!

Bob R
Aka �Cowboy Bob�
